user_question: What is the time complexity of the bubble sort algorithm?
final_answer: It's worth noting that bubble sort is generally considered one of the least efficient sorting algorithms for large datasets, and is not typically used in production code.

steps.content: What is the time complexity of the bubble sort algorithm?

<think>The time complexity of the bubble sort algorithm is O(n^2), where n is the number of items being sorted. However, in the best-case scenario where the input is already sorted, the time complexity can be O(n).</think>

This is because the algorithm works by repeatedly swapping the adjacent elements if they are in the wrong order. This process continues until no more swaps are needed, which in the worst-case scenario takes n*(n-1)/2 comparisons and n*(n-1)/2 swaps, which simplifies to O(n^2).
It's worth noting that bubble sort is generally considered one of the least efficient sorting algorithms for large datasets, and is not typically used in production code.
